titles.title: To amend title XI of the Social Security Act to require States to annually report on certain adult health quality measures, and for other purposes.
To amend title XI of the Social Security Act to require States to annually report on certain adult health quality measures, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Energy and Commerce. H. Rept. 115-716.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 551.

action.text: Mr. Walden moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5583.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: (Sec. 1) This bill requires the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services to expand its core set of adult health quality measures for Medicaid-eligible adults to include measures specific to behavioral health. A state Medicaid program must report annually on such measures.
